page.title: 13 Subsidence Around Blackwood
page.content: All the farms in the Blkwood area are under the threat of subsidence. The solidly built Blackwood House Farm is not in too much danger but the barn collapse. The builbings at Blackwood Pig Farm, not built on rafts, could be the first to fall down. As these buildings were built before the Whitemoor Mine, the owners can claim compensation. It would be cheaper for the N.C.B. to pay the farmers to knock down the buildings and build new ones, than to pay for alterations. Already the drive of Blackwood Pig Farm has had to be re-surfaced due to cracks and different levels of tarmac. All the houses are built on rafts, so that if our next-door-neighbour's house sinks, we'll either sink too or be higher up as the houses are semi-detached.
